newsitem.title: CHINA: China group begins market information service.
newsitem.headline: China group begins market information service.

text.p: A joint venture of three Chinese companies has begun providing financial news and information to domestic customers, officials of the company said on Friday.
The company, FutureInfo, was set up with capital of 20 million yuan ($2.4 million), officials of the new firm told reporters at a launch ceremony.
Each of the company's partners -- China International Futures Co Ltd, CAST Technology Group and Beijing Youlian Technology Development Co -- has a one-third share in the venture.
The group plans to offer Chinese-language reports on commodities and stock market trading as well as analysis, price data and other information.
The group would work with the Beijing Posts and Telecommunications Authority to provide information through Chinanet, the main Internet backbone in China, as well as an intranet network.
Officials said the service initially would be free to customers but fees would be set at a future date. They did not elaborate.
